oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Hound of the Baskervilles: Annotated with Reading Strategies
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A. Conan Doyle's entire classic "The Hound of the Baskervilles" with the addition of over 90 reading strategy experiences from over 55 areas to help readers with BEFORE, DURING, and AFTER reading strategies that students can practice and learn with.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cavanaugh, Terence
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: reading, strategies, strategy, reading strategy, reading strategies, classics, sherlock, holmes

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a collection of textbook materials assembled for MGF 1106 and MGF 1107 at Tallahassee Community College.  All content is from Creative Commons licensed sources.  Topics included are sets, Venn diagrams, statistics, measures of central tendency, measures of dispersion, measurement, metric system, conversion of units, geometry, length, area, volume,  similar triangles, logic, Euler diagrams, logical statements, negations, truth tables, logical arguments, probability, permutations, combinations, odds, voting methods, apportionment, finance, annuities, percent increase, percent decrease, income tax, FICA tax, numeration systems, base 2, Roman numerals, Egyptian numerals, graph theory, Euler paths, Euler circuits, Hamilton paths, Hamilton circuits, trees.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Novels of Fernando del Paso
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Provides the reader with a clear understanding of art in general, and prose fiction in particular, in Mexico and the Western world in our century. [The author's] commentaries on the modern and the postmodern are insightful, refreshing, and informative. . . . An indispensable companion to any serious study of contemporary Spanish American literature."--Alfonso Gonz lez, California State University, Los Angeles

Fiddian, Robin W.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: USA Elections in Brief
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This book discusses the nature of the modern American electoral process and how it works at the federal, state, and local levels. The process, complicated and sometimes confusing, has evolved to ensure universal suffrage to all men and women who are U.S. citizens 18 years of age or older.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Olson, Guy
Clack, George
United States Department of State
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States politics, United States elections, American elections, electoral politics
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Published in the public domain by the United States Department of State. A number of the excerpts and illustrations appearing in this volume are copyrighted. These may not be reprinted without the permission of the copyright holder.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Images of the Woman Reader in Victorian British and American Fiction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: At the same time that reading became a mark of gentility and a means to promote family unity, intellectual pursuits for the nineteenth-century woman were to be gained only in context of traditional domesticity. George Cruikshank’s “My Wife Is a Woman of Mind” (1847) demonstrates this point (fig. 1). Typical of midcentury political cartoons, Cruikshank’s caricature from The Comic Almanack, a predecessor of Punch, rekindles the Victorian controversy over women’s rights for education.1 Cruikshank’s “woman of mind” wears thick, dark glasses, symbolically designating her a thinker. This was a time when the popular pseudoscience of phrenology held sway; her hairstyle exposes a high forehead and two pronounced intellectual bumps: “ideality,” the faculty to conceive ideals; and “causality,” the ability to trace an effect to its cause. Her forehead marks the intelligence and curiosity of a woman who has seemingly traded her femininity and domesticity—as well as her eyesight—for knowledge. Potent objective signifiers, the volumes that line the bookcases and surround the table where she is writing reveal her active engagement in print culture and her easy access to books.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: University Press of Florida
Golden, Catherine J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: womens studies, victorian, literature, women, 19th century literature, 20th century literature, OGT+ Isbn: 9781616101190
